oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Nashville's lower Broad: the street that music made - Tape two of two - 2004-09-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion about Nashville's lower Broadway on September 17, 2004 from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. Moderated by Michael Gray. Tape two of two tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Rouda; Gary Bennett; Hank Cochran; Lois Shepherd; John Shepherd;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Continued from tape one. Includes questions from the audience. Hank Cochran tells stories about getting the scar on his face from Willie's wife -- Hank tells the story about Tootsie and her hat pin and drinking with George Jones -- Lois Shepherd tells story about Broadway May -- John Shepherd tells story about BR5-49 asking him to guest on the Grand Ole Opry with them -- John Shepherd tells story about items sold on lower Broad and the Lawrence Brothers record store -- John tells Opryland story.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rouda, Bill; Bennett, Gary; Cochran, Hank; Shepherd, John; Shepherd, Lois; Broadway (Tenn.); Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
